data.title: music in your language
data.meta_description: since i'm planning a full immersion on swedish and finnish, i thought that it might just help if i had some good quality stuff to listen to in those...
data.meta_site_name: Ultimate Metal Forum - Heavy Metal Forum and Community
data.text:
since i'm planning a full immersion on swedish and finnish, i thought that it might just help if i had some good quality stuff to listen to in those languages while learning. then i thought it could also be nice to share with each other good musical experiences from our own countries, provided the singing is in your own native language, or at least not english.

it doesn't matter (to me) whether it's metal or not. for instance, i really like kent and so i already started with my music in swedish. i lack some tunes in suomi though. please add if they're downloadable anywhere (no direct links tho), or if you are willing to share the stuff yourselves. i'm sure hyena and i can reciprocate with lots of interesting things in italian.

@argyle: and the name of that band/song was again...?

Timo Rautiainen & Trio Niskalaukaus (Metalll)

Tyrävyö

Moonsorrow

Finntroll (swedish)

Maija Vilkkumaa (if you like good pop-songs, but I guess you do?)

Verenpisara (I suppose that you will dig after a while. It´s cool!)

Ajattara (of the Amorphis-Singer)

Horna (Black Metal)

Ismo Alanko (Pop/Rock, an institution over all the years, really cool guy)

Zen Cafe

...have to think about more, but there are truckloads of. Then I`ll edit this post.

agree on Viikate

Lolita Vampiriá said:

what's the name of their latest radio hit? i think i've heard it and loved it but without the title i can't dload a thing...

and please do recommend your friends' bands' songs too, as long as they're available somewhere

M'kay kind sir.

Kotiteollisuus for example Minä olen (their latest radio hit single).

Try this if you will:

www.tajuvana.com -> musiikki -> there are some stuff downloadable. (And the pages are apparently in English too.)

Simo has just joined in Tajuvana as their new bassist (it's not official news yet but.. )

The closer thing i could think off is a former local band called Nightshades ( thast with an s at the end ). They lyrics where in english but it was a melodic black/death with songs about aztec culture writted in a really cool way. Music was good too but they started to be lacking ( no new songs for years at the time, and then only 1 new song, basically after several years of literally the same old songs, they effectively alienated everyone ) and other problems lead to their downfall.
